entries.title: One tidier to rule them all
entries.text: Apparently it is not entirly new, but I have not seen it announced earlier. The idea is to have a single interface and single configuration file to tidy perl, pod, html, JavaScript, CSS, etc...

entries.title: Building C and C++ libraries with Perl
entries.text: I am not sure why the harsh words - people can make mistakes - but the linked article is useful.

entries.title: Detecting Bots and Spiders with Plack Middleware
Precedence parsing made simpler
entries.text: Jeffrey Kegler explains how Marpa parses arbitrary BNF which was not the case with traditional parsers.

entries.title: Better source: svn client-side precommit hooks
WRE 0.9.4 released
entries.text: This is the newest release of the WebGUI Runtime Environment that contains Apache, MySQL, perl, ImageMagick and a bunch of CPAN modules. There was also a separate release announcement of WebGUI 7.10.26

entries.title: Remember to store errors!
entries.text: A nice example how adding code without understanding what the original did, and without proper testing can lead to lots of wasted hours (read loss of money) and probably loss of information too.

entries.title: Moose Role Usage Patterns
entries.text: This talk was given at YAPC::EU by Shawn M. Moore (sartak). I attended it along with a lot more people than could fit in the room. The slides include some explanation at the bottom.

entries.title: Slides for my YAPC::Europe 2012 Keynote
entries.text: From Ovid who wants you to understand what Agiel means. Also known as POP: People - Organization - Process.

entries.title: How to remove, copy or rename a file with Perl
entries.text: A simple entry on the Perl 5 Maven site.

entries.title: Oslo Perl Mongers Rock
entries.text: The main thing is that they organized Perl training classes with Damian and part of the income went to the Oslo.pm group. They could use that money to organize hackathons and even to donate to TPF. I can just recommend to follow the idea and organize training classes. - For example if you are interested in running a 'test automation using Perl' training class, you know where to find me :)

entries.title: Perl 5 Porters Weekly: August 13-August 19, 2012
entries.text: A quote quoted: >>One day we shall be able to boast that 'Perl 5 has *dropped* support for more platforms than your language has ever *had*'<<
